transliteration: Waḍ-ḍuḥā ... wa ammā biniʿmati rabbika faḥaddith
translation: By the morning light... and proclaim the favour of your Lord.
explanation: Revealed when the Prophet ﷺ felt abandoned, this sūrah gently lifts the heart: Allah has not left you. Your future will be brighter than your past; He cared for you before and will again. Count blessings and walk forward—your dawn is rising.
dua_use: Say: Yā Jabbār, heal my heart; Yā Raḥmān, surround me with Your mercy and hopeful mornings.

arabic: قُل لَّن يُصِيبَنَا إِلَّا مَا كَتَبَ ٱللَّهُ لَنَا...
transliteration: Qul lan yuṣībanā illā mā kataballāhu lanā...
translation: Say, nothing will befall us except what Allah has written for us; He is our Protector.
explanation: This āyah turns fear into trust: what reaches you is written for you, not against you. When Allah is your Wakīl, your heart can exhale—control rests with the Most Merciful.
dua_use: Say: Yā Wakīl, manage what I cannot; fill me with calm tawakkul and good expectations.

arabic: قُلْ يَا عِبَادِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسْرَفُوا ... لَا تَقْنَطُوا مِن رَّحْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ
transliteration: Qul yā ʿibādiya alladhīna asrafū... lā taqnaṭū min raḥmatillāh
translation: O My servants who have wronged themselves, do not despair of Allah’s mercy.
explanation: Allah personally calls the most broken ‘My servants’. The door is open—His mercy is greater than your past. Despair is not your destiny; returning is.
dua_use: Say: Yā Raḥīm, pull me from this darkness; forgive me completely and renew my heart.

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا تُوبُوا إِلَى ٱللَّهِ تَوْبَةً نَّصُوحًا
transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū tūbū ilallāhi tawbatan naṣūḥā
translation: O believers, turn to Allah with sincere repentance.
explanation: Naṣūḥ repentance cleans and closes the wound: stop, regret, return, repair. Allah loves those who keep coming back—this is not the end of your story.
dua_use: Say: Yā Ghaffār, accept my naṣūḥ repentance; cover my past and beautify my future.

translation: Those who restrain anger and pardon people—Allah loves the doers of good.
explanation: Power is not to explode—it’s to master the fire and choose iḥsān. Forgiveness frees you before it frees them, and Allah’s love awaits that choice.
dua_use: Say: Yā Ḥalīm, place forbearance in my chest; Yā ʿAzīz, give me strength to forgive.

arabic: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا * إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
transliteration: Fa-inna maʿal-ʿusri yusrā * inna maʿal-ʿusri yusrā
translation: Surely, with hardship comes ease; surely, with hardship comes ease.
explanation: Relief is paired with the test, not parked after it. Two eases flank your one hardship—breathe and take the next right step.
dua_use: Say: Yā Fatṭāḥ, open a way out and lighten what feels heavy.

arabic: لَا يُكَلِّفُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا
translation: Allah does not burden a soul beyond its capacity.
explanation: If it’s on your plate, it’s within your God-given capacity—with His help. This test is refinement, not punishment.
dua_use: Say: Yā Qadīr, give me strength and guidance to carry this well.

translation: If you are grateful, I will surely increase you.
explanation: Shukr multiplies blessings and shields the heart from envy. Gratitude transforms ordinary moments into worship and draws new rizq from the unseen.
dua_use: Say: Yā Razzāq, as I thank You, increase me in faith, health, and halal provision with barakah.

arabic: إِن يَنصُرْكُمُ ٱللَّهُ فَلَا غَالِبَ لَكُمْ
translation: If Allah helps you, none can overcome you.
explanation: Victory is not a headcount; it’s His Hand above yours. Align effort with taqwā and walk forward—backed by the Almighty.
dua_use: Say: Yā Naṣīr, be my Helper; make me firm and grant a good outcome.

arabic: وَمَن يَتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ يَجْعَل لَّهُۥ مَخْرَجًا ... وَيَرْزُقْهُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَحْتَسِبُ
transliteration: Wa man yattaqi-llāha yajʿal lahu makhraja ... wa yarzuqhu min ḥaythu lā yaḥtasib
translation: Whoever is mindful of Allah, He will make a way out for them and provide from where they do not expect.
explanation: Taqwā unlocks exits you can’t see and rizq you didn’t plan. Guard what Allah loves, and watch provision come from surprising doors.
dua_use: Say: Yā Razzāq, send halal provision with barakah; make for me a way out and a way up.

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا ٱسْتَعِينُوا بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَٱلصَّلَاةِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلصَّابِرِينَ
transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū-staʿīnū biṣ-ṣabri waṣ-ṣalāh; innallāha maʿaṣ-ṣābirīn
translation: O believers, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.
explanation: Sabr is active strength, not passive waiting. Pair it with ṣalāh and you are never alone—His ‘maʿiyyah’ (with-ness) is your greatest power.
dua_use: Say: Yā Ṣabūr, steady my heart and make my waiting worship.

arabic: أَلَمْ نَشْرَحْ لَكَ صَدْرَكَ * وَوَضَعْنَا عَنكَ وِزْرَكَ * ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنقَضَ ظَهْرَكَ * وَرَفَعْنَا لَكَ ذِكْرَكَ
transliteration: Alam nashraḥ laka ṣadrak ... wa rafaʿnā laka dhikrak
translation: Have We not expanded your chest, removed your burden, and raised your mention?
explanation: Allah reminds: expansion follows constriction; burdens can be lifted; your story can be raised. Hope is not imagination—it’s remembrance of His past help.
dua_use: Say: Yā Sharīḥ aṣ-Ṣudūr (O Expander of chests), widen my chest and raise my matter with You.
